-- Comprehensive Table Analysis
SELECT 
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(schemaname||'.'||tablename)) as table_size,
    pg_stat_get_tuples_returned(c.oid) as tuples_read,
    pg_stat_get_tuples_fetched(c.oid) as tuples_fetched,
    pg_stat_get_tuples_inserted(c.oid) as tuples_inserted,
    pg_stat_get_tuples_updated(c.oid) as tuples_updated,
    pg_stat_get_tuples_deleted(c.oid) as tuples_deleted,
    pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid) as live_tuples,
    pg_stat_get_dead_tuples(c.oid) as dead_tuples,
    CASE 
        WHEN pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid) > 0 
        THEN round((pg_stat_get_dead_tuples(c.oid)::float / pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid)::float) * 100, 2)
        ELSE 0
    END as dead_tuple_percentage,
    last_vacuum,
    last_autovacuum,
    last_analyze,
    last_autoanalyze
FROM pg_tables pt
JOIN pg_class c ON c.relname = pt.tablename
JOIN pg_stat_user_tables sut ON sut.relname = pt.tablename
WHERE schemaname = 'public'
ORDER BY pg_total_relation_size(schemaname||'.'||tablename) DESC;

-- Index Usage Analysis
SELECT 
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    indexname,
    idx_tup_read,
    idx_tup_fetch,
    idx_scan,
    CASE 
        WHEN idx_scan = 0 THEN 'UNUSED'
        WHEN idx_scan < 10 THEN 'LOW USAGE'
        WHEN idx_scan < 100 THEN 'MODERATE USAGE'
        ELSE 'HIGH USAGE'
    END as usage_category,
    pg_size_pretty(pg_relation_size(indexrelname::regclass)) as index_size
FROM pg_stat_user_indexes
WHERE schemaname = 'public'
ORDER BY idx_scan ASC, pg_relation_size(indexrelname::regclass) DESC;

-- Database Overview and Health Metrics
SELECT 
    'Database Size' as metric,
    pg_size_pretty(pg_database_size(current_database())) as value,
    'Total database size on disk' as description
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Active Connections' as metric,
    count(*)::text as value,
    'Current active database connections' as description
FROM pg_stat_activity 
WHERE datname = current_database()
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Total Tables' as metric,
    count(*)::text as value,
    'Number of user tables in public schema' as description
FROM pg_tables 
WHERE schemaname = 'public'
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Total Indexes' as metric,
    count(*)::text as value,
    'Number of indexes in public schema' as description
FROM pg_indexes 
WHERE schemaname = 'public'
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'PostgreSQL Version' as metric,
    version() as value,
    'Database server version information' as description
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    'Database Uptime' as metric,
    (now() - pg_postmaster_start_time())::text as value,
    'Time since database server started' as description;

-- Table and Index Bloat Analysis
WITH table_bloat AS (
  SELECT
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(schemaname||'.'||tablename)) as total_size,
    pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid) as live_tuples,
    pg_stat_get_dead_tuples(c.oid) as dead_tuples,
    CASE 
      WHEN pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid) > 0 
      THEN round((pg_stat_get_dead_tuples(c.oid)::float / (pg_stat_get_live_tuples(c.oid) + pg_stat_get_dead_tuples(c.oid))::float) * 100, 2)
      ELSE 0
    END as bloat_percentage,
    last_vacuum,
    last_autovacuum
  FROM pg_tables pt
  JOIN pg_class c ON c.relname = pt.tablename
  JOIN pg_stat_user_tables sut ON sut.relname = pt.tablename
  WHERE schemaname = 'public'
)
SELECT 
  *,
  CASE 
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 30 THEN 'CRITICAL'
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 20 THEN 'HIGH'
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 10 THEN 'MODERATE'
    ELSE 'LOW'
  END as bloat_level,
  CASE 
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 30 THEN 'Immediate VACUUM FULL required'
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 20 THEN 'VACUUM recommended'
    WHEN bloat_percentage > 10 THEN 'Monitor and consider VACUUM'
    ELSE 'No action needed'
  END as recommended_action
FROM table_bloat
ORDER BY bloat_percentage DESC, pg_total_relation_size(schemaname||'.'||tablename) DESC;
